snippet: Most large Chinese enclaves outside Asia have bright, elaborate gateways. New York’s do not, but efforts to get them are gaining momentum.
abstract: Most of the world's large Chinese immigrant communities have gateways, usually traditionally styled arches with intricate detailing, Chinese lettering and bright colors; historic core of Manhattan's Chinatown, one of the most venerable Chinese enclaves outside Asia, has no such structure, but in recent months efforts to build such a culturally symbolic threshold have accelerated; similar effort had begun in Brooklyn's Sunset Park.
lead_paragraph: Most large Chinese enclaves outside Asia have bright, elaborate gateways. New York’s do not, but efforts to get them are gaining momentum.

headline.main: Chinatowns Renew Push for Traditional Gateways
headline.print_headline: Chinatowns Renew Push For Traditional Gateways
